info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 11:52PM EDT until August 14 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following counties, Henderson and Transylvania.
* WHEN...Until 115 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1149 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The thunderstorms with heavy rain have moved east of the area. However, high water levels are still moving through area creeks and streams. - At 1130 PM EDT, the gauge on Mud Creek had a stage of 12 feet. Common, nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to Mud Creek is beginning. The lowest elevations of William H King Memorial Park are beginning to flood and floodwaters are approaching the lowest elevations of the Oklawaha Greenway. At this stage, more expansive lowland flooding with nuisance impacts to adjacent farmland, golf courses, and nurseries is ongoing or has recently occurred upstream closer to Erkwood Drive. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Brevard, Mills River, Flat Rock, Etowah, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Saluda, Rosman, Dupont State Forest, Jones Gap State Park, Caesars Head State Park, Looking Glass, B.R. Parkway-Black Balsam To Mount Pisgah, Bat Cave, Chimney Rock State Park, Valley Hill, Little River In Transylvania County, Crab Creek and Horse Shoe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
